data.title: Ketchup Entertainment
data.text:
Stream Memory Now!

Amazon Prime:

https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/0GCP0KXCNWBSR1A3PGTD5NRA6L

Vudu:

www.vudu.com/content/browse/details/Memory/2883942

Apple:

https://tv.apple.com/movie/memory/umc.cmc.2tkhfkjchi42s0abnmjn77ayh?itscg=30200&itsct=tv_box_link

Sylvia is a social worker who leads a simple and structured life. This is blown open when Saul follows her home from their high school reunion. Their surprise encounter will profoundly impact both of them as they open the door to the past.

Directed by: Michel Franco

Written by: Michel Franco

Starring: Jessica Chastain, Peter Sarsgaard, Merrit Wever

In theaters, Christmas Day

Ferrari is set during the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle and danger of 1950’s Formula 1, ex-racer, Enzo Ferrari, is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing ten years earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for their one son. Ferrari struggles with the acknowledgement of another. His drivers’ lust to win pushes them out to the edge. He wagers all in a roll of the dice on one race, the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia.

DIRECTED BY

Michael Mann

STARRING

Adam Driver

Penélope Cruz

Patrick Dempsey

Jack O'Connell

Shailene Woodley

Christmas Eve in Manchester and everyone is getting ready for Christmas… everyone, that is, except Anthony, a strange, enigmatic being with a remarkable ability: the power to find the lost. Over the course of one magical Christmas Eve, Anthony transforms the lives of five ordinary people, people whose lives have been shattered by decisions they have come to regret. But is Anthony’s ability to heal real, or just an illusion?

Directed by: John Hay

Written by: John Hay, David Logan

Starring: Eddie Izzard (The Riches), Jason Flemyng (Snatch)

Released: December 2011

Awards & Nominations: 1st International Emmy® Kids Awards, BAFTA Children’s Award (Nominated, Best Drama)

In Johannesburg, an American parole breaker unknowingly picks up a rental car that ties him to a web of corrupt local police.

Written & Directed by: Mukunda Michael Dewil

Starring: Paul Walker (The Fast and the Furious), Naima McLean, Gys de Villiers

Released: June 2013

On V.E. Day in 1945, as peace extends across Europe, Princesses Elizabeth and Margaret are allowed out to join the celebrations. It is a night full of excitement, danger, and the first flutters of romance.

Directed by: Julian Jarrold

Written by: Trevor De Silva, Kevin Hood

Starring: Sarah Gadon (Belle), Bel Powley (The Diary of a Teenage Girl), Emily Watson (Punch-Drunk Love), Rupert Everett (The Importance of Being Earnest)

Released: December 2015

Awards & Nominations: Breakthrough Performer (Bel Powley, Hamptons International Film Festival), Most Promising Newcomer (Bel Powley, Nominated, British Independent Film Awards)

In February 2012, an entire nation of basketball fans unexpectedly went ‘Linsane.’ Stuck in the mire of a disappointing season, the New York Knicks did what no other NBA team had thought about doing—they gave backup point guard Jeremy Lin an opportunity to prove himself. He took full advantage, scoring more points in his first five NBA starts than any other player in the modern era, and created a legitimate public frenzy in the process.

Directed by: Evan Leong

Written by: Aaron Strongoni (Narration)

Starring: Jeremy Lin, Daniel Dae Kim (Lost)

Released: October 2013

Awards & Nominations: Official Selection (Sundance Film Festival)

In the emotionally charged, wild, and humorous world of sixteen-year-old James Whitman, we see his struggle to overcome anxiety and depression by seeking advice from Dr. Bird - an imaginary pigeon therapist - in the wake of his sister's disappearance.

Directed by: Yaniv Raz

Written by: Yaniv Raz (screenplay), Evan Roskos (novel)

Starring: Lucas Jade Zumann, Jason Isaacs, Lisa Edelstein, David Arquette, Taylor Russell, Tom Wilkinson, Chase Stokes, Odiseas Georgiadis

Released: 2021

Forced to hit the road after the murder of his parents, Cayden Richards wanders, lost, without purpose... until he meets a certifiable lunatic named Wild Joe, who sets him on a path to the ominous town of Lupine Ridge to hunt down the truths of his history.

Written & Directed by: David Hayter

Starring: Lucas Till (X-Men: First Class), Stephen McHattie (300), John Pyper-Ferguson (Drive)

Released: November 2014

A recounting of Jack Kerouac’s (here known by the name of his fictional alter-ego Jack Duluoz) three sojourns to the cabin in Big Sur, owned by poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti. Based on the novel, Big Sur, by Jack Kerouac.

Written & Directed by: Michael Polish

Starring: Jean-Marc Barr (Dogville), Kate Bosworth (Superman Returns), Josh Lucas (American Psycho)

Awards & Nominations: Official Selection (Sundance Film Festival), Best International Film (Nominated, Munich Film Festival)

Two young pirates on the search for a lost brother, a vampire with heavy sunburns, a shape shifting queen and a raging ape army. Captain Sabertooth will face plenty of challenges when he sets out to find a lost magic diamond.

Directed by: Marit Moum Aune, Rasmus A. Sivertsen

Written by: Terje Formoe (story by), Karsten Fullu

Starring: Kyrre Haugen Sydness (voice), Siri Skjeggedal (voice), Leonard Valestrand Eike (voice), Ida Leonora Valestrand Eike (voice)

Released: February 8th, 2022

Forbidden love. Undying devotion.

The relationship between Ed, a married astronomer and Amy, his lover, who spend their years apart, is based only on phone calls and texts. One day Amy begins noticing something strange in Ed's messages.

Directed by: Giuseppe Tornatore

Written by: Giuseppe Tornatore

Starring: Jeremy Irons, Olga Kurylenko

Released: 2016

After a fight with her boyfriend, successful female erotic novelist on a book tour in Europe joins her ex and his female friend, with whom she falls madly in love, for a party at a castle owned by a dangerous cult.

Directed by: Craig Goodwill

Written by: Brian Clark

Starring: Analeigh Tipton, Marta Gastini, Jakob Cedergren

Released: September 2018

Prague, 1786. Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (Aneurin Barnard) spends a few turbulent months escaping the frustrating, privileged elite of Vienna. However, his unconventional presence soon unleashes a series of dramatic and tragic events. Overwhelmed by the tangled web of violence and intrigue that surrounds him and with his mind affected, Mozart creates the astonishing music and drama that becomes ‘Don Giovanni’.

Directed by: John Stephenson

Written by: Brian Ashby (screenplay by), Helen Clare Cromarty (screenplay by)

Starring: James Purefoy, Ian Bonar, Adrian Edmondson, Morfydd Clark, and Dervla Kirwan

Released: 2017

A group of small-town teens looking to drink a ton of beer in peace at a remote cabin in the woods find their party nearly ruined when they're stalked by the deranged Driller Killer in this horror/comedy featuring Michael Swaim.

Directed: Travis Long

Written: Michael Swaim

Starring: Michael Swaim, Jacob Reed, Beck Bennett, Brett Fancy, Kaitlin Large, Kyle Mooney

Released: 2012

A rebellious teenager forced to repeat her last year of high school is caught between adolescence and adulthood—and between two very different male admirers.

Written & Directed by: Kate Melville

Starring: Tatiana Maslany (Orphan Black), Spencer Van Wyck (Degrassi: The Next Generation), Steven McCarthy (The Strain)

Released: September 2012

Awards & Nominations: Best Picture (Whistler Film Festival), Best Performance in a Borsos Competition Film (Tatiana Maslany, Whistler Film Festival), ACTRA Toronto Award of Excellence (Tatiana Maslany), Audience Award for Best Narrative Feature (RiverRun International Film Festival), Breakthrough Performer (Tatiana Maslany, Hamptons International Film Festival), Discovery Award (Kate Melville, Nominated, Toronto International Film Festival)

Twenty-something New Yorker Barb Schwartz somehow ended up in a life that kinda... sucks. When Barb reunites with her childhood BFF, ballet dancer Billy, she is inspired to turn her life around by revisiting her first love: comedy.

Directed by: Jake Wilson

Written by: Sas Goldberg, Jake Wilson

Starring: Sas Goldberg (My Day), Jake Wilson (Moneyball), Hannibal Buress (Neighbors), Vanessa Ray (Frances Ha)

Released: September 2015

Orphan boy Pinky follows Captain Sabertooth on an exciting and dangerous journey across the big oceans to the kingdom of Lama Rama, hunting for a treasure and the answer to who is Pinky's father.

Directed by: John Andreas Andersen, Lisa Marie Gamlem

Written by: Lars Gudmestad

Starring: Tuva Novotny, Anders Baasmo Christiansen, Fridtjov Såheim

Released: September 2014
